page.title: 09Transport.
page.content: "A car is essential in this part of the country", said most of the inhabitants. Some owned more than one car .Public transport is very poor. Two buses, one each way, run on Thursdays only_ Knighton, Llangunllo and Gravel Arch. A bus goes to Newtown twice a month to coincide with Newtown market. One main road the A488 runs from Knighton to Llandrindod Wells. The B4355 Knighton to Newtown road goes in a northerly direction along the eastern edge. Other roads of the area are narrow lanes. An old drovers road crosses Bailey Hill. The nearest station is at Knighton. It is the Shrewsbury to Swansea, Wales Central Line.
